parameters.pythonCode:
import base64
from PIL import Image
from io import BytesIO

# ì¸í’‹ ì´ë¯¸ì§€ base64
raw_b64 = _('Make Pure Base64').first().json.SubImageBase64
pure_b64 = raw_b64.split(",")[-1]

img_data = base64.b64decode(pure_b64)
img = Image.open(BytesIO(img_data))

orig_w, orig_h = img.size

target_h = 8000
target_w = int(orig_w * (target_h / orig_h))

return {
    "original_width": orig_w,
    "original_height": orig_h,
    "resize_width": target_w,
    "resize_height": target_h,
}

import base64
from PIL import Image
from io import BytesIO

# base64 ë¶ˆëŸ¬ì˜¤ê¸°
b64 = _input.first().json.Info_Image
img_data = base64.b64decode(b64.split(",")[-1])
img = Image.open(BytesIO(img_data))

# RGBA â†’ RGB ë³€í™˜
if img.mode in ("RGBA", "LA"):
    img = img.convert("RGB")

# ë¦¬ì‚¬ì´ì¦ˆ (ì˜ˆì‹œ)
target_w = 700
orig_w, orig_h = img.size
ratio = target_w / orig_w
target_h = int(orig_h * ratio)
img = img.resize((target_w, target_h), Image.LANCZOS)

# JPEGë¡œ ì €ì¥
buffer = BytesIO()
img.save(buffer, format="JPEG", quality=90)
out_b64 = base64.b64encode(buffer.getvalue()).decode()

return {
    "resized_image": "data:image/jpeg;base64," + out_b64
}
